con:part.con:content: <wsdl:definitions xmlns:rmt2="rmt2.net" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/"> <wsdl:types> <xsd:schema> <xsd:include schemaLocation="../schemas/MultimediaRequest.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="../schemas/MultimediaResponse.xsd"/> </xsd:schema> </wsdl:types> <wsdl:message name="InMessage"> <wsdl:part name="InMessageRequest" element="MultimediaRequest"/> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:message name="OutMessage"> <wsdl:part name="OutMessageResponse" element="MultimediaResponse"/> </wsdl:message> <wsdl:portType name="DocumentMediaSearchInterface"> <wsdl:operation name="DocumentMediaSearch"> <wsdl:input message="InMessage"/> <wsdl:output message="OutMessage"/> </wsdl:operation> </wsdl:portType> <wsdl:binding name="DocumentMediaSearchSoapHttpBinding" type="DocumentMediaSearchInterface"> <soap:binding transport="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http" style="document"/> <wsdl:operation name="DocumentMediaSearch"> <soap:operation soapAction=""/> <wsdl:input> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:input> <wsdl:output> <soap:body use="literal"/> </wsdl:output> </wsdl:operation> </wsdl:binding> <wsdl:service name="DocumentMediaSearchService"> <wsdl:port name="DocumentMediaSearchEndpoint" binding="DocumentMediaSearchSoapHttpBinding"> <!--<soap:address location="http://rmt2.net/ServiceDispatch/soapRouter"/>--> <soap:address location="http://localhost:8080/server-external-webservices/services/web"/> </wsdl:port> </wsdl:service> </wsdl:definitions>

<xsd:schema xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xsd:include schemaLocation="RMT2_Message_Header_Type.xsd"/> <xsd:element name="MultimediaRequest"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="header" type="header_type" minOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">Known as the Web Service Header. This element is to be used as part of the request data. Contains the data needed to identify and route message to its property service implementation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="content_id" type="xsd:integer" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">This represents the primary key value of content database table.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="content" type="mime_content_type" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The content record</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:schema>

<xsd:schema version="1.0" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xsd:complexType name="header_type" mixed="false" abstract="false"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="routing" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">Represents the destination for this message</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="application" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">This is the application name in which this message is targeted.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="module" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">This is the application module name in which this message is targeted.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="transaction" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">This is the application module name in which this message is targeted.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="delivery_mode" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">How MOM is supposed deliver the message...Asynchronous or Synchronous</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string" id="delivery_mode_type"> <xsd:enumeration value="ASYNC"/> <xsd:enumeration value="SYNC"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="message_mode" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">Indicates if message is a request or response</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string" id="message_mode_type"> <xsd:enumeration value="REQUEST"/> <xsd:enumeration value="RESPONSE"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="delivery_date" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">The date and time this message was sent</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="session_id" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">The session id used to verify user authenticity and accessibility</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="user_id" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">The Id of the user requesting the service</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:schema>

<xsd:schema xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xsd:include schemaLocation="RMT2_Message_Header_Type.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="RMT2_Message_Reply_Status_Type.xsd"/> <xsd:include schemaLocation="mime/Mime_Content_Type.xsd"/> <xsd:element name="MultimediaResponse"> <xsd:complexType> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="header" type="header_type" minOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">Known as the Web Service Header. This element is to be used as part of the request data. Contains the data needed to identify and route message to its property service implementation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="reply_status" type="reply_status_type" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">The status of the content web service invocation. The return code will be greater than or equal to zero indicating the total number of records retrieved. Otherwise, a value less than zero is present when an error occurs.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="content" type="mime_content_type" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The content record</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:element> </xsd:schema>

<xsd:schema xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xsd:complexType name="reply_status_type" mixed="false" abstract="false"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="return_status" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">Indicates if the reply is successful or erroneous</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string" id="return_status_type"> <xsd:enumeration value="SUCCESS"/> <xsd:enumeration value="ERROR"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="message" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">This is the message text</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ext_message" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">This the long version of the message</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="return_code" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1" type="xsd:integer"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation xml:lang="en">The return code indicating success or failure</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:schema>

<xsd:schema xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xsd:include schemaLocation="Mime_Types_Type.xsd"/> <xsd:complexType name="mime_content_type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is the document that houses binary data and large text which the data elements can be mapped to the content table from the mime database. The binary data can be of any multimedia resource such as documents, images, audio, video, and other binary forms of data.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="content_id" type="xsd:integer" default="0" maxOccurs="1" minOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is the primary key. Will default to zero when record is new.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="mime_type_details" type="mime_type" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="unbounded"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Provides MIME type/sub type details.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="app_code" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Application code. This value can be cross referenced in the Authentication application.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="module_code" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The module of the application.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="filename" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The file name of the binary data at the time when persisted. This should include the file extension.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="filepath" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The file path of the where the binary data was found at the time when persisted.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="filesize" type="xsd:integer" default="0" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The size of the binary data in bytes.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="binary_data" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The data in binary code.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="text_data" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The data as text</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:schema>

<xsd:schema xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xsd:complexType name="mime_type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>This is the document that tracks MIME Type information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="mime_type_id" type="xsd:integer" default="0" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>MIME type id that serves as a foreign key value. Default to zero when record is new.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="file_ext" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The filename extension that is associated with the MIME Type.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="media_type" type="xsd:string" minOccurs="1" maxOccurs="1"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>The Type/Sub Type notation of the MIME.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:schema>
